DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria Known Sensitivity Study Drug or Excipient History Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Eligibility criteria indicator of whether or not the patient has a known allergic reaction to the study drug or related formulations.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Known Sensitivity Protocol Agent Or Pharmaceutical Excipient Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge._The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Any intentionally added component of a finished pharmaceutical product other than the claimed therapeutic or diagnostic ingredient(s). The excipients are added to facilitate administration or manufacture, improve product delivery, promote the consistent release and bioavailability of the drug, enhance stability, assist in product identification, or enhance other product characteristics. Pharmaceutical excipients do not affect therapeutic effects of the preparation or suitable tests or assays. The term does not apply to macromolecular compounds like albumin, or compounds like amino acids and sugars that are used in biological products, nor does it apply to process or product-related impurities (e.g. degradation products, residual solvents), or extraneous contaminants._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Known Sensitivity Protocol Agent Or Pharmaceutical Excipient Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.:The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.:A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any intentionally added component of a finished pharmaceutical product other than the claimed therapeutic or diagnostic ingredient(s). The excipients are added to facilitate administration or manufacture, improve product delivery, promote the consistent release and bioavailability of the drug, enhance stability, assist in product identification, or enhance other product characteristics. Pharmaceutical excipients do not affect therapeutic effects of the preparation or suitable tests or assays. The term does not apply to macromolecular compounds like albumin, or compounds like amino acids and sugars that are used in biological products, nor does it apply to process or product-related impurities (e.g. degradation products, residual solvents), or extraneous contaminants.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Concepts.definition: Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.
The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.
A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Any intentionally added component of a finished pharmaceutical product other than the claimed therapeutic or diagnostic ingredient(s). The excipients are added to facilitate administration or manufacture, improve product delivery, promote the consistent release and bioavailability of the drug, enhance stability, assist in product identification, or enhance other product characteristics. Pharmaceutical excipients do not affect therapeutic effects of the preparation or suitable tests or assays. The term does not apply to macromolecular compounds like albumin, or compounds like amino acids and sugars that are used in biological products, nor does it apply to process or product-related impurities (e.g. degradation products, residual solvents), or extraneous contaminants.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 1403 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao.mc 8/14/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a known
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known sensitivity to the study drug(s) or any of their formulation excipients?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has a prior history of serious allergic reactions associated with thalidomide or lenalidomide?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to dabrafenib, trametinib, and their excipients?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known hypersensitivity to any of the components of enasidenib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known hypersensitivity to selumetinib, vinblastine, or similar compounds?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known hypersensitivity to STS, sulfates, sulfites, or other thiol agents?

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for 1403 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao. mc 8/14/15
